trans-unit.source: Processes XAML in optimized BAML form and produces a XAML node stream.
BAML form is an optimized form of XAML used by the WPF XAML implementation.
It is optimized in the sense that it uses internal lookups and tokens for commonly used types or members.
The optimization is useful as an implementation detail that addresses packaging size and load time for WPF application scenarios that involve XAML.
The <xref:System.Windows.Baml2006.Baml2006Reader> reader class constitutes much of the public API surface that a WPF application developer has for interacting with BAML.
The XAML optimized to BAML form may need to be localized.
Localization of XAML and possible tools pathways for doing so is not discussed in this topic.
See [Globalization for WPF](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/globalization-for-wpf.md).
<xref:System.Windows.Baml2006.Baml2006Reader> uses an internally implemented XAML schema context.
This schema context provides the logic necessary for looking up the types in BAML form, including referencing the optimizations and tokens that are inherent in BAML.

The main scenario for <xref:System.Windows.Baml2006.Baml2006Reader> is to use it as the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReader> implementation that you pass to a call to <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlReader.Load%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Baml2006.Baml2006Reader"></xref> class based on an input stream.
Input stream of source BAML.
stream is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Baml2006.Baml2006Reader"></xref> class, based on the file name of a local file to read.
String that declares a file path to the file that contains BAML to read.
fileName is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Baml2006.Baml2006Reader"></xref> class based on an input stream and reader settings.
<xref:System.Windows.Baml2006.Baml2006Reader> uses an internal settings class override.

However you can pass the information that is permitted by the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReaderSettings> base class, and your passed settings are internally upgraded to or merged into the internal settings.
Passing `null` for `xamlReaderSettings` of this signature throws an exception.
If you have no special settings to report, use the <xref:System.Windows.Baml2006.Baml2006Reader.%23ctor%28System.IO.Stream%29> signature.
Input stream of source BAML.
Reader settings.
stream or xamlReaderSettings is `null`.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Baml2006.Baml2006Reader"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.
`true` to release the managed resources; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that reports whether the reader position is at the end of file.
`true` if the reader position is at the end of the file; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the current member at the reader position, if the reader position is on a <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.StartMember"></xref>.
The current member, or `null` if the position is not on a member.
Gets the XAML namespace from the current node.
The XAML namespace if available, otherwise `null`.
Gets the type of the current node.
A value of the enumeration.
Provides the next XAML node from the source BAML, if a node is available.
This method returns `false` for cases where the reader reports <xref:System.Windows.Baml2006.Baml2006Reader.IsEof%2A>.
`true` if a node is available; otherwise, `false`.
Reader was disposed during traversal.
Gets an object that provides schema context information for the information set.
An object that provides schema context information for the information set.
Gets the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlType"></xref> of the current node.
The <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlType"></xref> of the current node, or `null` if the position is not on an object.
Gets the value of the current node.
The value of the current node, or `null` if the position is not on a <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.Value"></xref> node type.
See <xref href="System.Xaml.IXamlLineInfo.HasLineInfo"></xref>.
`true` if line information is available; otherwise, `false`.
See <xref href="System.Xaml.IXamlLineInfo.LineNumber"></xref>.
The line number to report.
See <xref href="System.Xaml.IXamlLineInfo.LinePosition"></xref>.
The line position to report.
